units.title: Perform scATAC-seq
units.text: scATAC-seq was performed cell state accessible at differentially accessible peaks.
units.rationale: Describes the execution of scATAC-seq to capture chromatin accessibility.

units.title: snRNA-seq on adult cortex tissue
units.text: snRNA-seq was performed on sliced tissue cubes dissected from adult human, chimpanzee or bonobo, and macaque frozen prefrontal cortex tissue.
units.rationale: Specifies the sampling and sequencing of adult cortical nuclei.

units.title: Link DA peaks to nearest gene
units.text: a differentially accessible peak was linked to the nearest expressed gene within 1 Mb of that geneâ€™s transcription start site.
units.rationale: Defines the rule for associating peaks with putative target genes.

units.title: Detect differentially accessible peaks between species
units.text: Differentially accessible (DA) peaks were detected humans overlapping differentially accessible peaks and non-differentially between human and chimpanzee NPCs and neurons.
units.rationale: Outlines the comparative detection of DA peaks across species.

units.title: Peak enrichment analysis
units.text: Enrichment of accessible peaks (randomly sampled 2,000 times to match the number and selected biological-process gene ontology (GO) terms associated with average accessibility of differentially accessible peaks).
units.rationale: Describes statistical enrichment testing for functional annotation.

units.title: Classify peaks by genomic region
units.text: Bulk, single-cell and aggregated peaks located in exonic (Ex), promoter (Pr), intronic (In) or intergenic (Intergen) regions.
units.rationale: Categorizes peaks based on their genomic annotation.

units.title: t-SNE embedding of cell populations
units.text: ChromVAR29-based t-stochastic neighbour embedding (t-SNE) of human (left, 518 cells) and chimpanzee (right, 908 cells) with cells coloured by time point or cell state.
units.rationale: Visualizes cell similarity and temporal/state patterns.
